text: Rugby union at the 1983 South Pacific Games, currently known as the Pacific Games, was hosted at Apia, the capital of Western Samoa in September 1983. Fiji beat the host nation Western Samoa by 18–10 in the final to win the gold medal. ==Medal summary== {| |- |Men's rugby 15s |align=center | |align=center | |align=center | |} ==Teams== Competing teams were: : Pool A * * * * * * : Pool B * * * * * ==Group matches== ===Group A=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- :Note: Records for this tournament are incomplete. Western Samoa and Tonga qualified for the finals. ===Group B=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- :Note: Records for this tournament are incomplete. Fiji and New Caledonia qualified for the finals. ===Play-offs=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ==See also== * Rugby union at the Pacific Games ==References== rugby union 1983 Category:International rugby union competitions hosted by Samoa Category:1983 rugby union tournaments for national teams
title: Rugby union at the 1983 South Pacific Games
